events.description: Schema describing business change events, including fraud, mergers and acquisitions, antitrust investigations, and bankruptcy
events.name: Business Change

events.description: Events happening in the early stages of a business
events.name: Early Stages

events.description: Some form of corruption happens amongst the people in the business
events.name: Corruption
events.wd_description: form of dishonesty or criminal offense undertaken by a person or organization entrusted with a position of authority, to acquire illicit benefit or abuse power for one's private gain

events.description: Types of business fraud
events.name: Fraud

events.description: Regular audit to verify financial records
events.name: Audit
events.wd_description: Type of audit conducted to ensure "financial statements" are in accordance with specified criteria.

events.description: Financial records could not be validated, a criminal investigation case is opened
events.name: Criminal investigation
events.wd_description: in the legal sense exploration of a fact

events.description: Events leading to the business suffering economically
events.name: Market Shift

events.description: Company restructures to avoid bankruptcy
events.name: Restructure
events.wd_description: act of reorganizing the legal, ownership, operational, or other structures of a company

events.description: Process to merge or be acquired by another company
events.name: Mergers and Acquistions

events.description: Legal process after M&A or filing bankruptcy
events.name: Reorganization

events.description: Process in which a business files bankruptcy
events.name: Bankruptcy

events.description: The government may sue a business if they have reason to believe the business is becoming a monopoly
events.name: Antitrust investigation

events.description: A person founds a business
events.name: Found a business
events.wd_description: action of creating an organization or other entity intended to endure

events.description: Company is funded by private investors
events.name: Private funding
events.wd_description: act of providing resources

events.description: Company goes public and lists stock on the public market
events.name: Go public and sell IPOs
events.wd_description: transfer of equivalent goods to each other

events.description: Company goes private and sells all their stock to a private equity firm
events.name: Privatize
events.wd_description: transfer of equivalent goods to each other

events.description: Two companies form a partnership, but remain separate entities
events.name: Create partnership
events.wd_description: arrangement in which parties agree to cooperate to advance their mutual interests

events.description: Using deception to get money from individuals believing they are making donations to legitimate charity organizations, especially charities representing victims of natural disasters shortly after the incident occurs.
events.name: Charity fraud
events.wd_description: act of using deception to get money from people who believe they are making donations to charities

events.description: A fraudulent transaction or exchange that occurs in the context of an online auction site.
events.name: Internet auction fraud
events.wd_description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim

events.description: Fraud occurring when a payment is sent but the goods and services ordered are never received.
events.name: Nondelivery of merchandise
events.wd_description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim

events.description: Fraud occurring when goods and services are shipped or rendered but payment for them is never received.
events.name: Nonpayment of funds
events.wd_description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim

events.description: An individual is sent a payment significantly higher than an owed amount and is instructed to deposit the money in their bank account and wire transfer the excess funds back to the bank of the individual or company that sent it.
events.name: Overpayment scheme
events.wd_description: confidence trick designed to prey upon victims’ good faith

events.description: An individual is recruited to receive merchandise at their place of residence and subsequently repackage the items for shipment, usually abroad.
events.name: Reshipment scheme
events.wd_description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim

events.description: act of accusing or charging another with a crime
events.name: Accusation
events.wd_description: act of accusing or charging another with a crime

events.description: removal of the freedom of liberty by a state
events.name: Detention
events.wd_description: removal of the freedom of liberty by a state

events.description: verdict that results when a court of law finds a defendant guilty of a crime
events.name: Conviction
events.wd_description: verdict that results when a court of law finds a defendant guilty of a crime

events.description: answer to a claim made by someone in a criminal case under common law using the adversarial system
events.name: Plea
events.wd_description: answer to a claim made by someone in a criminal case under common law using the adversarial system

events.description: coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunal
events.name: Trial
events.wd_description: coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunal

events.description: A legal hearing
events.name: Legal hearing
events.wd_description: A legal hearing

events.description: formal decision made by a court
events.name: Court decision
events.wd_description: formal decision made by a court

events.description: decree of punishment in law
events.name: Sentence
events.wd_description: decree of punishment in law

events.description: Government fines the business
events.name: Fine the business
events.wd_description: financial penalty

events.description: Government breaks company up into multiple, smaller companies
events.name: Break up the business
events.wd_description: act of separating one entity to form several

events.description: Goverment arrests an executive of the company
events.name: Arrest executive
events.wd_description: detention of a person and taking it into custody, usually because it has been suspected of committing or planning a crime

events.description: Executive goes on parole
events.name: Parole
events.wd_description: provisional release from prison, with certain conditions such as probation in some states

events.description: Executive is officially released
events.name: Release from Jail
events.wd_description: process of releasing an inmate from prison

events.description: the legal result of a verdict of not guilty
events.name: Acquittal
events.wd_description: the legal result of a verdict of not guilty

events.description: Two companies end their partnership
events.name: End partnership
events.wd_description: termination of something

events.description: Company adopted a trend that fades away
events.name: Declining trend
events.wd_description: thing or behavior that achieves intense short-lived popularity and then fades away

events.description: Recession affects company's sales
events.name: Economic recession
events.wd_description: business cycle contraction; general slowdown in economic activity

events.description: A new company joins the market and the current company suffers
events.name: New competitor
events.wd_description: rivalry between organisms, animals, individuals, groups, etc., for mutually incompatible goals

events.description: A company contacts a candidate company to propose merge / acquisition
events.name: Contact suitable company
events.wd_description: act of conveying intended meanings from one entity or group to another through the use of mutually understood signs and rules

events.description: Company performs valuation on the candidate company
events.name: Valuation analysis
events.wd_description: process of estimating what something is worth, used in the finance industry

events.description: Companies negotiate terms of merge / acquisition
events.name: Negotiate terms
events.wd_description: act of conveying intended meanings from one entity or group to another through the use of mutually understood signs and rules

events.description: Company performs due diligence on candidate company
events.name: Due diligence
events.wd_description: investigation or exercise of care that a reasonable business or person is normally expected to take before entering into an agreement or contract with another party or an act with a certain standard of care

events.description: Companies sign a contract and officially merge / become acquired
events.name: Purchase and sale contract
events.wd_description: type of contract

events.description: Company officially applies for reorganization
events.name: Apply for reorganization
events.wd_description: act of asking politely or formally for something

events.description: Government approves the reorganization
events.name: Reorganization approval
events.wd_description: expression granting permission to proceed with a proposal

events.description: Government rejects the reorganization
events.name: Reorganization rejection
events.wd_description: act of declining to accept an item for approval, consideration, marking etc.

events.description: Company terminates some contracts and leases
events.name: Terminate contracts and leases
events.wd_description: termination of something

events.description: Liquidate or re-use some assets
events.name: Recover assets
events.wd_description: winding-up of a company

events.description: Company repays some debt to its creditors
events.name: Repay some debt
events.wd_description: transfer of an item of value from one party (such as a person or company) to another in exchange for the provision of goods, services or both, or to fulfill a legal obligation

events.description: Government contacts attorney to begin filing a lawsuit
events.name: Contact Attorney
events.wd_description: act of conveying intended meanings from one entity or group to another through the use of mutually understood signs and rules

events.description: Plaintiff files a complaint to initiate a lawsuit
events.name: File Complaint
events.wd_description: Legal document, the filing of which initiates a lawsuit

events.description: In law, a solemn assertion in opposition to someone or something by the defendant
events.name: Answer
events.wd_description: in law a solemn assertion in opposition to someone or something

events.description: Pre-trial procedure in common law countries for obtaining evidence
events.name: Discovery
events.wd_description: pre-trial procedure in common law countries for obtaining evidence

events.description: In US law, a procedural device to bring a limited, contested issue before a court for decision
events.name: Motion
events.wd_description: in US law, a procedural device to bring a limited, contested issue before a court for decision

events.description: Dispute resolution with assistance of an impartial third party moderator throughthe use of communication and negotiation techniques
events.name: Mediation
events.wd_description: dispute resolution with assistance of an impartial third party moderator through the use of communication and negotiation techniques

events.description: The dispute is resolved through a payment of money.
events.name: Settlement
events.wd_description: transfer of equivalent goods to each other

events.description: Coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunal
events.name: Trial
events.wd_description: coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunal

events.description: The formal decision made by a court following a lawsuit
events.name: Judgement
events.wd_description: the formal decision made by a court following a lawsuit

events.description: Resort to a superior court to review the decision of an inferior court or administrative agency
events.name: Appeal
events.wd_description: resort to a superior court to review the decision of an inferior court or administrative agency

events.description: Company officially applies for bankruptcy
events.name: Apply for bankruptcy
events.wd_description: act of asking politely or formally for something

events.description: Government approves the bankruptcy
events.name: Bankruptcy approval
events.wd_description: expression granting permission to proceed with a proposal

events.description: Government rejects the bankruptcy
events.name: Bankruptcy rejection
events.wd_description: act of declining to accept an item for approval, consideration, marking etc.

events.description: Government lends company money, because the company bankruptcy would damage the economy
events.name: Government bail out
events.wd_description: transfer of money that must be repaid

events.description: Government appoints a trustee to oversee the reorganization
events.name: Appoint trustee
events.wd_description: action which designates a person to carry out a function(s) as a public official

events.description: Trustee liquidates assets
events.name: Divestment
events.wd_description: reduction of some kind of asset for financial, ethical, or political objectives or sale of an existing business by a firm

events.description: Trustee distributes assets to creditors
events.name: Transfer Assets
events.wd_description: in property law, the transfer of ownership of a thing from one person to another

events.description: A new CEO or executive is hired
events.name: Management change
events.wd_description: process, event or action that deviates from the present state

events.description: Company hires new talent
events.name: Hire new talent
events.wd_description: relationship between the employee and the employer

events.description: Company fires some employees
events.name: Dismiss employees
events.wd_description: termination of employment decided unilaterally by employer
